nano.remexp.net
Class NanoSocketObserver

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.ThreadHandler
      nano.remexp.net.NanoSocketObserver
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class NanoSocketObserver
extends ThreadHandler

This class allows to observe running NanoSockets and check them for responses. If they did not respond in a while they are being flagged for removal.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Constructor Detail

NanoSocketObserver

public NanoSocketObserver()
Calls the constructor NanoSocketObserver(10000).

NanoSocketObserver

public NanoSocketObserver(long timeDelayAllowed)
NanoSocketObserver is a class that enables you to check your NanoSockets states. If a socket is flagged alive and the last time stamp of received data is older than the defined number of milliseconds, the NanoSocket receives the shutDown command.

Parameters:
timeDelayAllowed - the time in milliseconds a socket is allowed not to respond.
Method Detail

addSocket

public void addSocket(NanoSocket ns)
Inform this observer about a new socket that has been created. This socket will be added to the list of observed sockets in the beginning of the doTask method.

Parameters:
ns - the new socket.

removeSocket

public void removeSocket(NanoSocket ns)
Move a socket into the temporary list of sockets that need to be removed from this observer. the list of observed sockets will be updated in the beginning of the doTask method.

Parameters:
ns - the socket that is not used anymore.

doTask

public void doTask()
The NanoSocketObserver's task is to check whether a valid connection valid means it should be busy at the moment. This counts for the event sockets all the time and for the stream sockets when the remote experiment is scanning.

Specified by:
doTask in class ThreadHandler

shutDown

public void shutDown()
Description copied from class: ThreadHandler
Important! every implementation of the shutDown method has to call stopThread in order to be sure the thread is being shut down! (or otherwise set thisThread=null) Else the doTask method will be called over and over again and the thread won't die.

Specified by:
shutDown in class ThreadHandler
